info.description: The Rating Service is responsible for rating insurance risks with multiple carriers. The endpoints accept rate requests, as well as a polling for responses based on the correlation ID received when sending a request.
info.title: Rating Service

tags.name: Rating
tags.description: REST API to manage rate requests and responses.

post.description: Submit a rate request for one or more rating units.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: rateRequest
parameters.description: A line of business specific rate request.

get.summary: Retrieve Rate Responses by Correlation ID and Rating Unit ID
get.description: Retrieve the rating unit’s rate response corresponding to the correlation ID obtained from the initial rate request.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

get.summary: Retrieve Rate Responses by Correlation ID
get.description: Retrieve all completed rate responses corresponding to the correlation ID obtained from the initial rate request. Call repeatedly until receiving a response for each rating unit in the request, or timeout at your discretion.

parameters.name: productId
parameters.description: ID of the product for which the request is being made

parameters.name: tenantId
parameters.description: ID of the tenant for which the request is being made

parameters.name: entityId
parameters.description: ID of the entity for which the request is being made

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to include in the response

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page of items to retrieve

liabilityRatingGroup.description: The liability rating group of the residence location as defined for Massachusetts. Applies to MA.

numberOfFamilies.description: The number of families at the residence.

occupantType.description: Indicates whether this residence is inhabited by the owner, or rented out.

residenceId.description: A unique identifier for the residence within the context of a rate transaction.

country.description: The country name, in ISO 3166-1 'alpha 2' code format

subRegion.description: The subregion (county, parish, or borough) associated with the address

type.description: The type of address. These are the specific types required for rating.

fax.description: The fax number for the agency

biteHistory.description: Indicates if this animal has a bite history.

theftDeductible.description: The total out of pocket cost towards a theft claim.

namedInsureds.description: Named individuals whose interests are protected under the policy.

currentOrPriorPolicy.description: The policy that is currently in force or was last in force.

continuousCoverageInYears.description: The number of years of continuous coverage.  Optional.

priorLapseDaysInLast3Years.description: The number of whole years where there has been any lapse in coverage within the last three years.  Optional.

priorLapseMonthsInLast3Years.description: The number of partial years in months where there has been any lapse in coverage within the last three years.  Optional.

reasonForLapse.description: If coverage has lapsed, what is the reason.

messages.description: Messages from the carrier related to the policy. May also contain processing error messages or API validation messages.

reasonForNoInsurance.description: If there is no current/prior insurance, what is the reason.

yearsWithAgency.description: The number of whole years the applicant has been with the agency.

monthsWithAgency.description: The number of partial years in months the applicant has been with the agency.

billingPlan.description: The desired billing payment schedule for the new policy.

paymentOption.description: The desired billing payment type for the new policy.

militaryDiscountEligible.description: Indicates if the named insured or a family member is an active U.S. service member or veteran.

cededBusiness.description: Indicates whether the policy has been turned over to the North Carolina Reinsurance Facility (NCRF).  False indicates the rate request is submitted voluntarily for high risk tiers.  Applies to NC.

termMonths.description: The desired term in months for the new policy. This field is equivalent in effect to 'expirationDate'.

premium.description: The total premium for the policy.

ratedTermMonths.description: The number of months in the policy term.

A coverage is a risk that an insurance policy covers the insured against.

medPayPerPersonLimit.description: Medical payments per person.  Applies to AR, DC, DE, FL, KY, MI, ND, NY, OR, PA, TX, UT, WA.  DE: Delaware offers split limits for medical payments.  Use medPayPerAccidentLimit and medPayPerPersonLimit for split or just medPayCombinedSingleLimit for CSL.MA: Part 2 Compulsory limit $8,000.  Use excessMedPayLimit for part 6.  MD: The basic option is a $2,500 limit.  Use excessMedPayLimit for an increased limit.  MI: Use unlimitedPip to specify an Unlimited MedPay limit. Otherwise, use medPayPerPersonLimit.  PA: Only applies if combinedFirstPartyTotalBenefitsLimit is not included. Basic (minimum) coverage is $5,000 with a max of $100,000. For additional coverage, use excessMedPayLimit.

medPayPerAccidentLimit.description: Medical payments per accident.  Applies to DE.

medPayCombinedSingleLimit.description: Medical payments combined single limit.  Applies to DE.

combinedFirstPartyTotalBenefitsLimit.description: Combined First Party Benefits total benefits limit.  Applies to PA.  When sending a CFPB limit, medPayPerPersonLimit, workLossLimit, funeralExpenseLimit, and accidentalDeathLimit are implied,  but excessMedPayLimit can still be used to increase medical coverage after the first $100,000 of medical expenses.  The CFPB limit represents a combination of the other limits.  Rating may adjust limits to a valid combination.  Optionally, leave combinedFirstPartyTotalBenefitsLimit blank and supply the individual limits specifically.  Refer to state regulations.

excessMedPayLimit.description: Excess medical payment limit.  Applies to DC, KS, MA, MD, MN, NJ, PA. PA: Only applies after the first $100,000 of medical expenses. MA: Part 6. NJ, PA: a.k.a. Extraordinary Medical Benefits.

workLossIndicator.description: PIP coverage generally includes medical and workloss benefits.  Applies to AR, NJ, UT.  Some states allow for exclusion of work loss on some or all individuals.  Refer to state regulations.  Set workLossIndicator to false to exclude work loss.  True or null indicate Full PIP.  FL: Use flPipOption for work loss options.  NY: Work loss cannot be excluded, but coordination may be applied - use coordination.

workLossLimit.description: Work loss limit.  Applies to DC, MI, MN, PA.  PA: Reflects the total work loss benefit limit.  Monthly limits are inferred. Only applies if combinedFirstPartyBenefitsLimit is not included.MI: Represents an increased work loss limit

accidentalDeathIndicator.description: Accidental death coverage.  Applies to AR, NY.  NY: Referred to as Add'l Death Benefit.

accidentalDeathLimit.description: Accidental death coverage limit. Applies to FL, PA, TX. PA: Only applies if combinedFirstPartyBenefitsLimit is not included.

funeralExpenseLimit.description: Funeral expense coverage limit.  Applies to DC, PA.  PA: Only applies if combinedFirstPartyBenefitsLimit is not included.

pipDeductible.description: PIP deductible.  Applies to DE, FL, KY, MA, MI, NJ, NY, OR.  MN: Not applicable, use medPayDeductible and workLossDeductible instead.

medPayDeductible.description: PIP medical payments deductible.  Applies to MN.

workLossDeductible.description: PIP work loss deductible.  Applies to MN.

coordination.description: Coordination means the applicant's primary heealth insurance will help cover costs of injury in an automobile accident.  Applies to MI, ND, NJ, NY.
